title: Rear ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Removal

body.body: Rear ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Removal
Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Seat and Battery - remove - D72; D92; DB; DB2; DBX; DC3; DC4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DT3; DU; DU3; DUY; DZ
Disconnect the battery, negative (black) lead first (see

body.body: Remove left hand side panel except DC
Remove the left hand side cover (see

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DA2; DTC; DCZ; DPZ; DEX; D34; DD4; D64; D54; DP4; DC4; DU4; DT4; DB4; D74; DR4; DS4; D72; D92; D71; DSB; DSA; DSX; DS1; DG4; DF4; DB2; DU3; DT3; DF2; DF; DE2; DE; DD2; DUY; DU; DPA; DP; DZ; DBX; DB

body.body: Rear Wheel Speed Sensor - Remove D Series Except DE/2 DF/2 DD2
Note the routing of the wheel speed sensor harness and it clips for installation.
Disconnect the wheel speed sensor electrical connector, identified as the white connector.
Detach the ABS sensor cable and brake hose clips from the left hand side of the swinging arm.
Note the routing of the ABS wheel speed sensor harness for installation.
Route the sensor harness to the rear caliper.
Note the location of the shim for the ABS wheel speed sensor for installation.
Release the fixing securing the wheel speed sensor to the rear brake caliper carrier, and remove the sensor. Collect the shim.
